abstract.p: Cruise ship evacuates 1,200 passengers, mostly Americans, and 300 crew members off Aegean island of Santorini, Greece, when ship begins listing after striking bed of rocks (S)

block.p: Four warships and two military helicopters joined a fleet of commercial vessels that rushed to evacuate 1,200 passengers, mostly Americans, and 300 crew members from a cruise ship that ran aground off the Aegean island of Santorini while trying to dock. The authorities said the cruise ship, the Sea Diamond, operated by Louis Hellenic Cruise Lines, began listing after striking a bed of rocks about a mile from the coast. The ship was later towed from the rocks. It had left Greece's main port of Pireaus on Monday for a weeklong island-hopping cruise in the Aegean.
